FIELD.name: GENERAL PROCESSING DATA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains fixed-length coded data applicable to records of materials in any media

SUBFIELD.name: General Processing Data
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data entered in $a is identified by character position within the subfield. Conventionally the character positions are numbered from 0 to 35. The character positions defined must appear in the subfield. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Date Entered on File
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
Eight numeric characters in ISO standard form (ISO 8601-1988) for dates: YYYYMMDD where YYYY represents the year, MM the month with leading 0 if necessary and DD the day of the month with leading 0 if necessary.
The date will usually be the date when the record was originally created and entered into machine-readable form, to give some idea of the age of the record. A record corrected because of errors in keying or editing will not have a change of date. On exchange, the record should also retain its original date.

EXAMPLES.EX: Character positions 0-7: 19671005 The record was originally entered into a machine-readable data file on 5th October 1967.

PSUBFIELD.name: Type of Publication Date
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
A one-character code indicates the type of date according to eleven categories which take into account the issuing status of the item being recorded. This code defines the types of dates which appear in Publication Date 1 (character positions 9-12) and Publication Date 2 (character position 13-16). These dates are always entered as a four character representation of the year.
Note: It may not be possible always to provide blanks as required for dates from source formats where any digit has been supplied as an approximation in a corresponding field.

ITEM.name: currently published serial
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Publication date 1 contains the beginning year of publication or coverage if coverage differs from publication (EX 1). If the beginning date is uncertain, any unknown digit may contain a blank (EX 2). Publication date 2 contains 9999.

ITEM.name: serial no longer being published
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Publication date 1 contains the beginning year of publication or coverage if coverage differs from publication. If the beginning date is uncertain, any unknown digit may contain a blank. Publication date 2 contains the year publication ceased (EX 3). For works known to have ceased but whose final date is uncertain, any unknown digit may contain a blank (EX 4).

ITEM.name: serial of unknown status
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A serial about which it is not known whether publication is continuing or whether publication has ceased (EX 5). Publication date 1 contains the beginning year of publication or coverage if coverage differs from publication. If the beginning date is uncertain, any unknown digit may contain a blank. Publication date 2 contains four blanks.

ITEM.name: monograph complete when issued, or issued within one calendar year
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A monograph published in one volume/part or in a number of volumes/parts all published at one time or with the same date of publication, i.e. published within the same calendar year (EX 6-9). If the date is uncertain use code 'f' (see below). If the monograph was published over a span use code 'g'. Publication date 1 contains the date of publication. Publication date 2 contains blanks.

ITEM.name: reproduction of a document
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item being catalogued is a reproduction, i.e. a reprint, facsimile, reissue, etc. but not a new edition (EX 10). If the reproduction is of a serial, or if either the original or the reproduction was published over a span of years, the beginning year of reproduction and publication are used (EX 11). Publication date 1 contains the date of publication of the reproduction. Publication date 2 contains the date of publication of the original. If either date is uncertain and cannot be expressed as a single year, any digit may be replaced by a blank (EX 12).

ITEM.name: monograph, date of publication uncertain.
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Publication date 1 contains the earliest possible date of publication. Publication date 2 contains the latest possible date of publication (EX 13-16).

ITEM.name: monograph whose publication continues for more than a year
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Publication date 1 contains the beginning year of publication (EX 17-19). If the beginning year of publication is uncertain, any unknown digit may be replaced by a blank. Publication date 2 contains the date of final publication (EX 17) or 9999 if publication is still in progress (EX 18). If the final date of publication is uncertain, the unknown digits contain blanks (EX 19). >

ITEM.name: monograph with both actual and copyright/privilege date
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item's date of publication differs from the copyright/privilege date quoted in the item (EX 20). If the date of publication is unknown, use 'd' (EX 8). Privilege is defined as a monopoly granted by a government body to an author or a bookseller for an edition over a fixed period of time. Publication date 1 contains the date of publication. Publication date 2 contains the copyright/privilege date.

ITEM.name: monograph with both release/issue date and production date.
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Used for films, music etc. when there is a gap between the production/recording of an item and its distribution/release (EX 21). Publication date 1 contains the release/issue date. Publication date 2 contains the production date.

ITEM.name: document with detailed date of publication
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Use when it is considered important to record the month (and possibly day) of publication (EX 22). Publication date 1 contains the year of publication. Publication date 2 contains the detailed date in the form "MMDD", with month and day right-justified with zero fill. If the day positions are not used, they hold blanks (EX 23).

ITEM.name: date(s) of publication unknown
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Use when no date at all can be assigned to the item (EX 24, 25). Publication date 1 contains blanks. Publication date 2 contains blanks.

EXAMPLES.EX: a19599999 A serial was first published in 1959 and is still being published.
al92#9999 A serial was first published at a date somewhere between 1922 and 1925 and is still being published.
bl8101860 A serial began in 1810 and finished in 1860.
b1890191# A serial began in 1890 and finished somewhere between 1910 and 1915.
c1980#### A serial began in 1980; but issues are no longer arriving and the publisher cannot be traced.
d1750#### An item actually or probably published in 1750. The date may be recorded in subfield 210$d variously as 1750, [1750] or [1750?].
d1972#### A monograph was published in three volumes in 1972.
d1972#### An item where only the copyright date is known. Code 'h' is therefore not used.
d1995#### An item with a publication date of 1416 according to the Muslim calendar, known to have been published in 1995 C.E.
e19681952 A document originally published in 1952 was reprinted in 1968.
e19561835 A serial published from 1835 to 1914 was reprinted in 1956-1958.
e1983183# A book originally published in the 1830s (date uncertain) was reprinted in 1983.
f19621966 A monograph has no date of publication but its contents reveal it was published no earlier than 1962 and it was acquired in 1966. It is assumed it was published between 1962 and 1966.
f17801789 A monograph believed to have been published in the 1780s; the date is given in subfield 210$a as [178-?].
f19941995 An item with an imprint date of 5755 according to the Jewish calendar; the precise year C.E. has not been determined; but it must be either 1994 or 1995.
f####1510 The item was published in or before 1510.
g19751976 A monograph was published in 3 volumes in 1975 and 1976.

g19839999 A monograph is to be published in 5 volumes, the first in 1983 and the rest at future dates. The record is an open-ended record since the bibliographic details of the as yet unpublished volumes are not known.
g1962196# A monograph began publication in 1962. The date of the final volume is uncertain, but is believed to be 1968 or 1969.
h19851983 A document published in 1985 has 1983 as copyright date.
i19501943 A film made in 1943 but not released until 1950.
j19850412 A technical report published 12 April 1985.
j198511## A report published in November 1985. The day of publication is not known or is considered unimportant.

u######## 200 1#$aViola Springs Limestone$bObject 300 ##$aMid-Ordovician The item is a rock. Character positions 9-16 cannot cater for a date range of 478 to 458 million years; so code 'u' is assigned
u######## 210 ##$aParisii$cGourm$d[s.aº.] The record is the result of unedited retrospective conversion; it is not possible to derive even approximate dates from the data in the source file.

PSUBFIELD.name: Target Audience Code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: There are three positions for target audience codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks.

ITEM.name: juvenile, general
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Use instead of b, c, d or e when these codes have not been used or cannot be used.

PSUBFIELD.name: Government Publication Code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether the record is for a government publication or not and the level of government issuing the publication. A government publication is defined as one issued or financed by a government agency. Academic institutions are not to be regarded as government agencies.

ITEM.name: federal/national
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Sovereign states and territories with some measure of self-government, for example having their own legislature.

ITEM.name: state/province
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An administrative subdivision at one level below the federal or national level, having some measure of internal self-government and legislative control, though with no responsibility for external affairs, e.g. provinces of Canada, Länder in the Federal Republic of Germany.

ITEM.name: county/department
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A middle-level administrative subdivision, generally without any legislature, e.g. départements in France, counties in the United Kingdom.

ITEM.name: local (municipal, etc.)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An administrative unit at the lowest level of jurisdiction, e.g. a city, town, or village.

ITEM.name: multi-local (interstate departments, etc. below the national level)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Any administrative unit below the national level combining or crossing more than one jurisdiction, e.g. a joint computer unit which is shared by a number of municipal authorities or a transport authority that crosses several municipalities.

ITEM.name: intergovernmental
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: International organisations and their agencies, e.g. those entities which are capable of making treaties with sovereign states such as the International Monetary Fund or the United Nations.

ITEM.name: government in exile or clandestine
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A non-official government such as the government of France in exile from 1941-1944.

ITEM.name: level not determined
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Used when the record is for a government publication but the level of government cannot be determined from the information at hand.

ITEM.name: unknown
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Used when it is impossible to determine whether the work is a government publication.

ITEM.name: not a government publication
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: This code is entered in all cases when the document is not a government publication.

ITEM.name: other government level
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Used when the record is for a government publication at a particular level of government but this level does not fit into any of categories a-g.

PSUBFIELD.name: Modified Record Code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This one-character code indicates whether the character set available is sufficient to transcribe the data as found on the item. Due to limitations of the machine character set, the transcription may have to be modified to accommodate, for example, special scripts (i.e. by transliteration) or special mathematical formulae, e.g. a Greek letter or other notation written out in full. A record would not be considered modified, however, if the title page cannot be transcribed because it contains symbols or pictures which obviously would be found in no other character set.

PSUBFIELD.name: Language of Cataloguing
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
A three-character code indicating the language used in cataloguing. For the list of codes see Appendix A. If a source record is completely multi-lingual, i.e. all information not from the title page is repeated in more than one language, it is recommended that a separate UNIMARC record should be produced, as required, for each language.
UNIMARC has no mechanism to denote the language of individual fields throughout the format.

PSUBFIELD.name: Transliteration Code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: UNIMARC assumes the utilisation of international standards. However, in the area of conversion of scripts, international standards are not yet completely adequate, and other schemes may be used. This code indicates whether or not an ISO transliteration scheme is used in the record.

ITEM.name: multiple transliterations: ISO or other schemes

PSUBFIELD.name: Character Set
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two two-character codes designating the principal graphic character sets used in communication of the record. Positions 26-27 designate the G0 set and positions 28-29 designate the Gl set. If a Gl set is not needed, positions 28-29 contain blanks. For further explanation of character coding see Appendix J. The following two-character codes are to be used. They will be augmented as required.

ITEM.name: ISO 5426-2 (Latin characters used in minor European languages and obsolete typography)

PSUBFIELD.name: Character Set
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two two-character codes indicate up to two additional graphic character sets used in communication of the record. The two-character codes specified for character positions 26-29 are used. Positions 30-31 designate the G2 set and positions 32-33 designate the G3 set. If no additional character sets are needed the bytes contain blanks.

PSUBFIELD.name: Script of Title
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code indicating the alphabet of the title used as the title proper or, in the case of serials, the keytitle. This refers to the alphabet in the source item, not the character set of the record. The following codes are recommended in the absence of any international standard set of codes.

RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Related fields are noted in connection with the individual codes above.

EXAMPLES.EX:
100 ##$al960ll04al9599999m##c0engy01031####ba The record was originally entered into a machine-readable data file on 4th November 1960. The serial was first published in 1959 and is still being published. The target audience is "general adult". The serial is an annual report published by Hampshire County Council; it is an unmodified record, catalogued in English, using no transliteration scheme.
Character position Value Notes 0-7 19601104 Date entered on file 8 a Currently published serial. 9-12 1959 Commencement of publication. 13-16 9999 Serial still being published. 17-19 m## Target audience general adult. 20 c A subdivision of a sovereign state, without any legislature. 21 0 Unmodified record. 22-24 eng English language of cataloguing. 25 y No transliteration scheme used. 26-29 0103 ISO 646 (IRV) and ISO 5426 8-bit codes used. 30-33 #### No additional character set. 34-35 ba Latin alphabet of title.

100 ##$al9830202bl8101860|||y0frey0103####ba The record was originally entered into a machine-readable data file on 2nd February, 1983. The serial was first published in 1810 and ceased publication in 1860. The target audience code is not used, and therefore contains fill characters. The record has not been modified, no transliteration scheme is used, and French is the language of cataloguing.
Character position Value Notes
0-7 19830202 Date entered on file. 8 b Serial no longer being published. 9-12 1810 Beginning of publication. 13-16 1860 End of publication. 17-19 ||| Target audience not designated. 20 y Not a government publication. 21 0 Unmodified record. 22-24 fre French language of cataloguing. 25 y No transliteration scheme used. 26-29 0103 ISO 646 (IRV) and ISO 5426 8-bit codes used. 30-33 #### No additional character sets. 34-35 ba Latin alphabet of title.

FIELD.name: LANGUAGE OF THE ITEM
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded information relating to the language of an item, its parts, and its title, as well as an indication of the language of the original if the item is a translation

IND1.name: Translation indicator
IND1.DESCRIPTION: This indicator specifies whether or not the item is a translation or contains translations.If it is not possible to allocate this indicator in records converted from a source format, the fill character should be used in place of the values outlined above. Value '2' should not be used if the only translations in the document are summaries of articles, etc., in the document.

OPTION.name: Item is in the original language(s) of the work (EX 3, 5, 7, 12)
Item is a translation of the original work or an intermediate work (EX 1, 2, 4, 6)
Item contains translations other than translated summaries (EX 8-11)

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Text, Soundtrack etc.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language of the text, soundtrack etc. Repeatable when the text is in more than one language (EX 5).

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Intermediate Text when Item is Not Translated from Original.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language of any intermediate translation (EX 2, 4, 6). Repeatable when the text is translated from more than one intermediate language (EX 6), or when the translation has occurred via more than one intermediate language (e.g. Greek - Latin - French - English).

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Original Work
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language of the original work when the item being recorded is a translation (EX 1, 2, 4, 6, 8). Repeatable when the original is in more than one language.

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Summary
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language of any summaries or abstracts of the item or of works, articles, etc. contained within it. Repeatable when the item contains summaries in more than one language (EX 7).

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Contents Page
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This subfield is reserved for the language of the table of contents when this differs from the language of the text (EX 3). Repeatable for each language of the contents page(s).

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Title Page if Different from Text
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language of the title page when it differs from the language or languages of the text (EX 8). Repeatable for each language of the title page.

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Title Proper if Not First Language of Text, Soundtrack, etc
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: This subfield contains the language of the title proper when it differs from that in the first or only occurrence of subfield $a (EX 1). This is not repeatable since the title proper is by definition in one language. Any repeats of the title proper in other languages are parallel titles and their language is indicated in a subfield $z in field 200.

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Libretto, etc.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language or languages of the text when the item being catalogued includes the vocal/textual content of the work(s) printed as text, whether as accompanying material or printed with the item. Note that this subfield is not limited to librettos as such. Repeatable. (EX 9)

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Accompanying Material (Other than Summaries, Abstracts or Librettos)
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language or languages of accompanying material, such as programme notes, prefaces, commentaries, instructions etc. Repeatable. (EX 10)

SUBFIELD.name: Language of Subtitles
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The language(s) of subtitles (overprinted titles) of moving pictures when different from the language of the soundtrack. Repeatable (EX 11, 12)

RELATED.name: GENERAL PROCESSING DATA
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Language of Cataloguing (character positions 22-24) In these character positions is entered a code indicating the language used by the cataloguer for those parts of the record such as the notes which do not depend on the language of the item.

RELATED.name: TITLE AND STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITY
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: The language(s) of the parallel title(s) proper appearing in this field may be indicated in the $z subfield(s) in field 200.

RELATED.name: RELATED TITLES
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Various title fields have a subfield indicating the language of the title contained in the title subfields. These are used when a title is in a language other than the main language of the work.

EXAMPLES.EX: 101 1#$afre$ceng$geng A book entitled Guidebook to Henry VIII's Palace of Hampton Court is a French translation of an English original. The title proper is in English, and is followed by a parallel title in French; the rest of the text is in French.

101 1#$afre$beng$crus A scientific research paper published in Russian is translated by an international agency into English. This intermediate text is then used by a national research institute in France to produce a French translation.
X 3 101 0#$ajpn$eeng$feng A Japanese government publication contains a table of contents and an added title page in English; the rest of the text is in Japanese.

101 1#$aeng$bger$crus A traveller's diary is published as Journey to Khiva through the Turkoman country by Nikolay Murav'yov, translated from the German by W S A Lockhart, and originally published in Russian.
101 0#$aeng$awel A local government publication from Gwent County Council consists of a parallel Welsh-English text.

1 1#$aeng$bger$bfre$cakk A text in Akkadian, an ancient language, has been translated parts into German and parts into French. An English translation is made based on the German and French translation.

101 0#$aeng$afre$ager$deng$dfre$dger IFLA Journal contains abstracts of all its contributions in English, French and German. The majority of the contributions are in English followed equally by French and German which are entered in alphabetical order.
101 2#$amul$ceng$ffre A book intended for a French readership and having a French title page consists mostly of one act of a play of Shakespeare translated from the English into 25 languages.
101 2#$afre$hfre$hger A sound recording sung in French with accompanying text in French and German.
101 2#$ieng A nonlanguage sound recording with programme notes in English.
101 2#$aswe$jfre A copy of Bergman's "Tystnaden" with French subtitles.
101 0#$jeng A copy of Chaplin's "Modern times" with English subtitles.

FIELD.name: COUNTRY OF PUBLICATION OR PRODUCTlON
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains codes for one or more countries of publication or production of the item.

SUBFIELD.name: Country of publication
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Contains a code representing the country in which the item was published or produced. The codes are to be taken from the two-character codes of ISO 3166 (see Appendix B). Repeatable if an item is published in more than one country.

SUBFIELD.name: Locality of publication
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A code representing the locality where the item was published or produced. ISO TC46 is considering a proposal to establish an international system for codes for regions. Until such a standard exists, agencies may use any established national or internationally accepted code in this subfield. Repeatable if an item is published in more than one locality.

RELATED.name: PUBLICATION, DISTRIBUTION, ETC.
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field carries the place of publication or production in textual form.

RELATED.name: PLACE ACCESS
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field carries the place of publication or production in structured textual form.

EXAMPLES.EX: 102 ##$aHU The item is published in Hungary
102 ##$aGB$bst The item is published in Scotland
102 ##$aUS$bca$aUS$bny The item is published in California and New York.
102 ##$aIT The item was published in Venice in 1485.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: TEXTUAL MATERIAL, MONOGRAPHIC
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to monographic printed language materials.

SUBFIELD.name: Monograph Coded Data
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data entered in $a is identified by character position within the subfield. Conventionally the character positions are numbered from 0 to 12. All character positions defined must appear in the subfield. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Illustration codes
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
There are four character positions available for illustration codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks. If more than four codes are applicable, select the first four in the order they appear on the list below. Note that blanks are used in preference to 'y' in unused character positions.
These codes usually relate to terms in the physical description of the item. If the data element is not used, fill characters should be entered in character positions 0-3; if they are used but fewer than four types of illustration are present, then remaining positions contain blanks.

ITEM.name: illustrations
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Use for types of illustrations which are not covered below, e.g., diagrams, graphs, or when types of illustrations are not being specifically coded.

ITEM.name: portraits
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Individual or group portraits.

ITEM.name: charts
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Special purpose maps designed for the use of navigators.

ITEM.name: plans
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. ground plans of buildings.

ITEM.name: plates
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A leaf containing illustrative matter with or without explanatory text, which does not form part of any sequence of pages or leaves

ITEM.name: music
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: As monographic textual material. For sound recordings accompanying materials use code 'm'.

ITEM.name: facsimiles
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Reproductions of a part of or the whole of a document not only reproducing the text but also simulating the original appearance of the work.

ITEM.name: sound recordings
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. a sound disc in a folder in a book

ITEM.name: transparencies
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. a set of transparencies in a pocket attached to a book.

ITEM.name: illuminations
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Manuscript embellishments of a letter or writing with colours

ITEM.name: no illustrations
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: To be used only once, i.e. y###.

PSUBFIELD.name: Form of contents codes
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: There are four character positions available for the form of contents codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks. If more than four codes are applicable, select the first four in the order in which they appear in the list below. These codes should be used whether the item contains this form of material or consists completely of this form of material except in the case of code 'c', index, which should be used only if the item is an index. Thus, if an item is a catalogue, code 'b' will be used; if it contains a catalogue within it, along with other material, again, 'b' will be used. If the data element is not used, fill characters should be entered in character positions 4-7. If a form not listed is required, code 'z' is used.

ITEM.name: bibliography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A list of the bibliographic items sharing one or more common features such as subject, place of publication.

ITEM.name: catalogue
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A list of bibliographic items in a collection or exhibition or available from a particular agency such as a publisher or bookshop.

ITEM.name: index
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An alphabetical list of terms, i.e. names or subject giving the locations where they can be found elsewhere. For an index to the text of the book itself use Index indicator character position 10.

ITEM.name: abstract or summary
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Includes descriptive, indicative, and informative abstracts.

ITEM.name: dictionary
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Alphabetical listings of words with a short description of their meaning and usage or with equivalents in another language.

ITEM.name: encyclopaedia
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Listing of names or terms on a given subject with an extensive description usually alphabetically arranged.

ITEM.name: directory
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Ordered list of persons, organizations or places, with information about each.

ITEM.name: statistics
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Numerical facts on a subject systematically collected and usually arranged in tabular form.

ITEM.name: programmed text book
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A text book in which material is presented to be learnt immediately before passing on to the next section.

ITEM.name: patent
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A document including a specification of a new invention giving the right to maker or sell it for a certain number of years. Includes patent applications.

ITEM.name: standard
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A document produced by an official body specifying a recommended way of producing an object with a view to achieving high quality.

ITEM.name: dissertation or thesis
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A statement of investigation or research presenting the author's findings and any conclusions reached, submitted by the author in support of his candidature for a higher degree, professional qualification or other award.

ITEM.name: laws and legislation
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Items including texts of laws. For treaties use code 's'.

ITEM.name: numeric table
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Numerical information presented in a tabular form. Use code 'i' if the data is statistical.

ITEM.name: technical report
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A document containing the findings of an investigation or study of a scientific or technical subject.

ITEM.name: examination paper
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A set of questions printed for use in an examination.

ITEM.name: literature surveys/reviews
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Narrative surveys, often critical, of activity in a specific field as documented in the literature, often linked to a bibliography. Also known as current publication surveys.

ITEM.name: treaties
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Formally concluded and ratified agreements between states. For other laws use code 'n'.

ITEM.name: cartoons or comic strips
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Books published as cartoons for children or adults

PSUBFIELD.name: Conference or meeting code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating whether the item contains the proceedings, reports, or summaries of a conference, meeting or symposium. This may be used whether or not the conference, etc., is given a formal entry.

PSUBFIELD.name: Festschrift indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating whether the item is a festschrift. A festschrift is defined as a complimentary or memorial publication in the form of a collection of essays, addresses or bibliographical, scientific or other contributions often embodying the results of research, issued in honour of a person, institution or society, usually on the occasion of an anniversary celebration.

PSUBFIELD.name: Index indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating whether the item contains an index to its text. If the item is an index to a different work see character positions 4-7 Form of contents codes, code 'c'.

PSUBFIELD.name: Literature code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: When the work is a literary text a one-character code indicates the type of literary text.

ITEM.name: drama
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Includes television plays, scenarios, etc.

ITEM.name: humour, satire
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: For cartoons, etc. see character positions 4-7 Form of contents codes, code 't'

ITEM.name: letters
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: As a literary form. For correspondence see character position 12 Biography code

ITEM.name: poetry
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Includes non-literary works in verse

ITEM.name: multiple or other literary forms
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is known to be literary but the precise form is not known, e.g. because of lack of specificity in the source format or more than one code applies.

PSUBFIELD.name: Biography code 4
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: When the work is biographical a one-character code indicates the type of biography

ITEM.name: autobiography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Includes letters, correspondence

ITEM.name: collective biography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. works containing biographies of more than one person or of a family

ITEM.name: contains biographical information
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. directory, who's who

RELATED.name: RECORD LABEL
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Implementation Codes (character positions 6 and 7) Character position 6 in the RECORD LABEL designates whether the item is text material and character position 7 indicates whether it is monographic.

RELATED.name: CODED DATA FIELD: TEXTUAL MATERIAL PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field holds further coded data pertaining specifically to the physical form of the item.

RELATED.name: DISSERTATION (THESIS) NOTE
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field can hold free text on items coded 'm' in $a/4-7

EXAMPLES.EX:
105 ##$abf##a###001yb A document contains maps and plates. It has a bibliography and an index. It is about the life and travels of one individual. The components of the example 105 field are as follows:
Character position Value Notes
0-3 bf## Item contains maps and plates but no other illustrated material. 4-7 a### Item has a bibliography but no other distinctive form of contents. 8 0 Not a conference publication. 9 0 Not a festschrift. 10 1 Item has an index. 11 y Not a literary text. 12 b Individual biography.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: TEXTUAL MATERIAL - PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to the physical form of textual material.

SUBFIELD.name: Textual Material Coded Data Physical Medium Designator
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one character code indicates the physical medium of the item. The following codes are used:

VOCABULARY.name: Textual Material Coded Data Physical Medium Designator

ITEM.name: multimedia (e.g. an item in regular print with a microfiche supplement)

RELATED.name: RECORD LABEL, character position 6, Type of Record
CODED DATA FIELDS for other types of materials
TITLE AND STATEMENT OF RESPONSIBILITY subfield $b, General Material Designation
EDITION IN A DIFFERENT MEDIUM
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Used to link the current record to the original physical medium of the item.

RELATED.name: UNIFORM TITLE subfield $b, General Material Designation

EXAMPLES.EX: 106 ##$ae The item is a newspaper.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: SERIALS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to serials including monographic series catalogued as series rather than as individual monographs.It is recommended that it should always be present in records of serials.

SUBFIELD.name: Serial Coded Data
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data entered in $a is identified by character position within the subfield. Conventionally the character positions are numbered from 0 to 10. All character positions defined must appear in the subfield. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Type of serial designator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one character code indicating the type of serial.

ITEM.name: periodical
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A type of serial in which the parts (called issues) are generally characterised by variety of contents and contributors, both within the issue and from one issue to another. With the general exception of newspapers and some other types of popular periodicals, issues are commonly designed and numbered as constituents of a volume which is completed at determined intervals, usually annually, at which point a volume title page, contents page and index may be issued.

ITEM.name: monographic series
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A type of serial characterised by each part having a distinctive title and often individual authorship in addition to the series having a constant title. Each part will usually contain only a single work or a closely related group of works. Systematic or sequential numbering of parts is a common but not invariable further characteristic.

ITEM.name: newspaper
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A type of periodical characterised by the fact that it contains topical information and is usually printed in columns down each page

PSUBFIELD.name: Frequency of issue
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating the frequency of a serial.

ITEM.name: no frequency (i.e. irregular). See also character position 2 below.

PSUBFIELD.name: Regularity
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating the regularity of a serial

VOCABULARY.name: A one-character code indicating the regularity of a serial

ITEM.name: regular
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial is issued at regular intervals

ITEM.name: normalised irregular
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial is not completely regular, but is irregular in a predictable pattern, e.g. monthly except July-August)

PSUBFIELD.name: Type of material code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating whether a serial, as a whole, is one of certain frequently used types of reference materials. One character position only is available and the category most prominent in the item should be selected.

ITEM.name: bibliography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The serial consists of a bibliography, e.g., a national bibliography

ITEM.name: catalogue
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A list of bibliographic items in a collection or exhibition or available from a particular agency such as a publisher or bookshop, e.g. a publisher's catalogue in serial form.

ITEM.name: index
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. a serial index to a serial. For the availability of an index to the serial itself see character position 9.

ITEM.name: abstract or summary
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Includes descriptive, indicative and informative abstracts.

ITEM.name: dictionary
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial consisting of an alphabetical listing of words with a short description of their meaning and usage or with equivalents in another language.

ITEM.name: encyclopaedia
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial listing names or terms in a given subject with an extensive description usually alphabetically arranged.

ITEM.name: directory
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Ordered list of persons, corporate bodies or places with information about each

ITEM.name: yearbook
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial designed to present a body of reference matter intended to be revised at annual intervals, or reporting or reviewing the year's work or the main events of the year in a particular field of interest.

ITEM.name: statistics
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Numerical facts on a subject systematically collected and usually arranged in tabular form, e.g. statistical reports.

ITEM.name: programmed texts
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serial in which material is presented to be learnt immediately before passing on to the next section.

ITEM.name: reviews
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: i.e. a serial consisting of book reviews and/or reviews or moving pictures, etc.

ITEM.name: laws and legislation
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Documents including texts of laws.

ITEM.name: law reports and digests
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Regular reviews of legal proceedings.

ITEM.name: legal articles
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Articles in a journal dealing with general legal topics.

ITEM.name: legal cases and case notes
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Reports and discussions on legal cases.

ITEM.name: biography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Used when a serial consists of an individual bibliography, collective biographies or contains biographical information, e.g. a who's who.

ITEM.name: literature surveys/reviews
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Narrative surveys, often critical, of activity in a specific field as documented in the literature, often linked to a bibliography. Also known as state-of-the-art reviews.

ITEM.name: cartoons or comic strips
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Serials published as cartoons for children or adults.

PSUBFIELD.name: Nature of contents code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Three characters indicating whether a serial contains one or more frequently-used types of reference materials, to be distinguished from Type of material code which indicates what the serial is. Up to three codes can be used (left justified); unused positions contain blanks. If more than three codes are appropriate, their order in the list determines which are recorded. The codes given for character position 3 above are used.

PSUBFIELD.name: Conference publication indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating whether the serial contains the proceedings, reports or summaries of a conference, meeting or symposium, e.g. annual conference proceedings.

PSUBFIELD.name: Title page availability codes
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating the existence of a title page for separate volumes of a serial and the method of acquisition.

ITEM.name: in first issue of next volume-loose
in first issue of next volume-attached
unknown at time of record creation

PSUBFIELD.name: Index availability code
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicating the availability of an index or a table of contents for separate volumes of a serial and the method of acquisition. A serial which is an index is indicated by code 'c' in character position 3.

ITEM.name: each issue contains an index to its own contents-loose
in last issue of volume-loose- separately paged
in first issue of next volume-loose-separately paged
in first issue of next volume-loose-unpaged
in first issue of next volume-attached
published separately-bound from publisher-free upon request
published separately-bound from publisher-purchase upon request
this serial is a supplement or subseries indexed in its parent serial
unknown at time of record creation
no cumulative index or table of contents
= cumulative index or table of contents available

RELATED.name: RECORD LABEL, Bibliographic level (character position 7)
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Bibliographic level in the RECORD LABEL designates whether the item is a serial, hence whether this field would be expected to be present.

EXAMPLES.EX:
110 ##$aakahg##1zzl The yearbook of a learned society includes mainly its conference proceedings and a directory of its members. Each volume is bound with title page and index. An index is published every five years. The components of this field are as follows.
Character position Value Notes
0 a Periodical 1 k Annual 2 a Regular 3 h Yearbook 4-6 g## Contains director information 7 l Contains proceedings of annual conference 8 z Other (title page is part of annual volume) 9 z Other (index is part of annual volume) 10 l Cumulative index available

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELDS: VISUAL PROJECTIONS, VIDEORECORDINGS AND MOTION PICTURES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains fixed-length coded data applicable to visual projections, videorecordings and motion pictures as defined by ISBD(NBM).

SUBFIELD.name: Coded Data - General.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Subfield $a Fixed-length Data Elements

PSUBFIELD.name: Type of material
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the type of material.

PSUBFIELD.name: Length
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Three numeric characters give the length of the material indicated in the preceding character, Type of material. Length for motion pictures, videotapes, or electronic videorecordings will be expressed in minutes; length for filmstrips, slides, or transparencies will be expressed in number of frames, number of slides, or number of transparencies, respectively. If the length is not known or the type of material is not specific, this data element contains three blanks (###). If the length exceeds three characters, this data element contains three zeros (000). The number is right justified; unused positions contain zeros.

EXAMPLES.EX: picture that is 19 minutes long Type of material: a Length: 019 Filmstrip that is 44 frames in length Type of material: b Length: 044

PSUBFIELD.name: Colour indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the colour characteristics.

ITEM.name: combination of black and white and colour

PSUBFIELD.name: Sound indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether the sound is on the medium or separate.

PSUBFIELD.name: Media for sound
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the medium used to carry the sound, when sound is present.

ITEM.name: optical sound track on motion picture film
magnetic sound track on motion picture film
optical and magnetic sound track on motion picture film

PSUBFIELD.name: Width or dimensions
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the width of films or the dimensions of slides, transparencies, and videotapes.

ITEM.name: 2 x 2 in. (5 x 5 cm.) r = 8 x 10 in (20 x 25 cm.)

PSUBFIELD.name: Form of release - visual projection, motion picture
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the form of release.

VOCABULARY.name: Form of release - visual projection, motion picture

ITEM.name: not a motion picture or visual projection
other forms of release. See character position 15 for form of release for videorecording.

PSUBFIELD.name: Technique - video-recording, motion picture
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the technique used for motion pictures and videorecordings.

ITEM.name: not a motion picture or video recording

PSUBFIELD.name: Presentation format - motion picture
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether a motion picture has used a standard or special presentation format.

PSUBFIELD.name: Accompanying material
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Alphabetic character codes indicate the types of material that accompany the material. Up to four codes can be used (left justified), unused positions contain blanks. If more than four codes are appropriate, their order on the following list determines which are recorded.

ITEM.name: electronic videorecording (EVR)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: NOTE: 'Electronic videorecording (EVR)' is an obsolete form of video recording on 16mm film.

VOCABULARY.name: NOTE: 'Electronic videorecording (EVR)' is an obsolete form of video recording on 16mm film.

ITEM.name: Beta (videocassette).
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: home video format introduced in 1975 by Sony Corporation

ITEM.name: VHS (videocassette)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Home video format developed by Japan Victor Corporation (JVC) and marketed in 1977.

ITEM.name: U-matic (videocassette)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Video format using Sony's trademark name, referring to its tape threading path in a U-shape. Also known as "U type standard".

ITEM.name: EIAJ (reel)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The standard ½-inch reel-to-reel helical scan videotape format. Named for the Japanese standards committee (the Electronics Industries Association of Japan) which set the standard for ½ inch video tape recorders manufactured since 1969.

ITEM.name: Type C (reel)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Video format using one recording head, with tape speed at 9.61 inches per second. This is the broadcast standard in most countries. Type C equipment and technology is made by Sony, RCA, and others.

ITEM.name: Quadruplex (reel)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Video system using four recording heads, developed by Ampex in the 1950s.

ITEM.name: Laser optical (Reflective) videodisc
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A grooveless, smooth round plastic disc with a mirrorlike surface, usually 12" in diameter, on both sides of which is stored video information. The disk is read by a weak laser beam. This system became available to the public in 1978 and is currently used in home and industrial applications.

ITEM.name: CED (capacitance electronic disk) videodisc
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A grooved, plastic disk, usually 12" in diameter, containing information recorded as deep pits in the bottom of the grooves, and played by an electronic stylus. In 1984 RCA, the manufacturer of CED videodisc players, announced its decision to cease production.

ITEM.name: V2000 (videocassette)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Home video format developed in Europe by Philips since 1980. Reversible.

ITEM.name: Video8 (videocassette)
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Home video format.

PSUBFIELD.name: Base of emulsion material - visual projection
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to specify the type of material for the base of the emulsion. The following values are used:

VOCABULARY.name: Base of emulsion material - visual projection

ITEM.name: film base other than safety film
mixed collection (containing more than one type of base)

PSUBFIELD.name: Secondary support material - visual projection
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to specify the type of material used for the mounting.

PSUBFIELD.name: Broadcast standard - videorecording 1
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the number of lines (and the system where necessary).

SUBFIELD.name: Motion Picture Coded Data Archival.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Subfield $b Fixed-length Data Elements

PSUBFIELD.name: Generation
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character position indicates the generation of the film.

PSUBFIELD.name: Production elements
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the production elements of the film. If more than one production element is present, code for the element considered most important.

PSUBFIELD.name: Refined categories of colour for moving pictures
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the colour category.

VOCABULARY.name: Refined categories of colour for moving pictures

ITEM.name: not applicable (item not a colour film)

PSUBFIELD.name: Film emulsion (polarity)
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the type of film base.

PSUBFIELD.name: Film base
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the type of film base.

PSUBFIELD.name: Kind of sound for moving images
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the number of channels for sound reproduction the item is designed to support.

VOCABULARY.name: Kind of sound for moving images

PSUBFIELD.name: Kind of film stock or print
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the type of colour film stock or colour print.

VOCABULARY.name: Kind of film stock or print

PSUBFIELD.name: Deterioration stage
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one character code indicates the amount of deterioration of the film stock. If more than one condition is present, use the code for the most serious condition.

PSUBFIELD.name: Completeness
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether film is judged to be complete or not.

ITEM.name: not applicable (when it is impossible or inapplicable to determine completeness, e.g. home movies, unedited footage, out-takes, unidentified material)

PSUBFIELD.name: Film inspection date 1
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A six-character code records the most recent film inspection date. The components of the date are: (a) Year. Four numeric characters (b) Month. Two numeric characters, right justified. Unused positions contain zeros.

EXAMPLES.EX: 198109 Last inspection date was September 1981.
198300 Last inspection date was in 1983. The month is not known.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: GRAPHICS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to non-projected graphics as defined by ISBD(NBM) (e.g. prints and photographs) needed for library and museum-based cataloguing.

SUBFIELD.name: Coded Data for Graphics
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data entered in $a is identified by character position within the subfield. The subfield is currently always 18 characters in length. Conventionally the character positions are numbered 0-17. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Specific material designation
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to record the specific material designation that describes the special class of material (usually the class of physical object) to which the item belongs. The following codes are used:

ITEM.name: drawing
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An original visual representation (other than a print or painting) made with pencil, pen, chalk, or other writing instrument on paper or similar non-rigid support.

ITEM.name: painting
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An original visual representation produced by applying paint to a surface.

ITEM.name: photomechanical reproduction
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Any picture produced in imitation of another picture through the use of a photographic process to transfer the image to a printing surface. Hence, a snapshot made to document a painting or a Xerox copy of a print are considered photomechanical reproductions. Art reproductions, postcards, posters, and study prints are included here.

ITEM.name: photonegative
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A piece of film, a glass plate, or paper on which appears a "negative" image, i.e. directly opposite to a "positive" image (photoprint), slide, or transparency. Used to produce a positive print. Does not include negative photoprints, photoprints that are a combination of negative and positive images, photographs or solarized prints, all of which are considered to be techniques used when making photoprints.

ITEM.name: photoprint
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A positive image made either directly or indirectly on a sensitised surface by the action of light or other radiant energy. The term "photoprint" is used here as a more precise term than "photograph", which technically can cover both the print and the negative. Radiographs and opaque stereographs are included here.

ITEM.name: picture
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A two-dimensional visual representation accessible to the naked eye and generally on an opaque backing. This term is used when a more specific designation is unknown or not desired.

ITEM.name: print
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A design or picture transferred from an engraved plate, wood block, lithographic stone, or other medium. Generally, there are four types: planographic print, relief print, intaglio print, and stencil print.

ITEM.name: technical drawing
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A cross section, detail, diagram, elevation, perspective, plan, working plan, etc., made for use in an engineering or other technical context.

ITEM.name: other non-projected graphic type
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Other types not included in the above. Includes mixed media productions made by a combination of freehand and printing techniques when one or the other does not predominate. In some cases, where mixed media are applied, one must decide whether the creator intends the item to be a photoprint (even though it is painted over the photographic image). Hand colouring is considered a technique applied to a printing process; this aspect is covered by a character position 3. Computer-produced graphics and the various duplication masters (including spirit masters and transparency masters) are included here.

PSUBFIELD.name: Primary support material
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to specify the type of material used for the primary support (i.e., the support or base on which an image is printed or executed) of a non-projected graphic. The following codes are used:

PSUBFIELD.name: Secondary support material
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION:
A one-character code is used to specify the type of material (other than normal museum matting) to which the primary support is attached (mounting).
This character position is coded only when the mount or mat is of historical, informational, aesthetic, or archival importance. (In other cases code "y" is used.) The same codes are used within this element as with Primary support material (Character position 1), with the following additional code:

PSUBFIELD.name: Colour
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to specify the colour of the non-projected graphic item. The following codes are used:

ITEM.name: one-colour, monochrome
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The image is printed or executed in one colour. Code "a" is used for monochrome art works. It is not used with photographic materials.

ITEM.name: black-and-white
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The image is printed or executed in black and white.

ITEM.name: multicoloured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The image is printed or executed in more than one colour.

ITEM.name: hand coloured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The image, produced by a printing or photographic process, is hand coloured.

ITEM.name: mixed
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The work or collection is a combination of one-colour, black-and-white, coloured, hand-coloured, and/or other images.

ITEM.name: not applicable
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The characteristic is not appropriate to the type of material being presented.

ITEM.name: other
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The image has colour characteristics other than specified above, e.g. stained, tinted, toned (e.g. sepia).

PSUBFIELD.name: Technique (drawings, paintings)
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code is used to specify the technique in which drawing and paintings are executed. There are three two-character positions for technique codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks. If a graphic is not a drawing or painting, the first character positions contain xx (Not Applicable) and the remaining positions contain blanks. The following codes are used:

PSUBFIELD.name: Technique (prints)
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code is used to specify the technique in which prints are executed. There are three two-character positions for technique codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks. If a graphic is not a print, the first two character positions contain xx (Not Applicable) and the remaining positions contain blanks. The following codes are used:

PSUBFIELD.name: Functional designation
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code is used to describe the functional form of the item. If the code does not apply, the two character positions contain xx (Not Applicable). The following codes are used:

ITEM.name: architectural drawing
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Graphic delineation made for the design and construction (or documentation of design and construction) of sites, structures, buildings, details, fixtures, furnishings, and decorations, as well as other objects designed by an architect or architectural office.

ITEM.name: item cover
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Cover forming the binding or outer enclosure of an item, i.e. hardback or paperback book covers, record sleeves, etc. Covers may be detached or attached to the item.

ITEM.name: sticker
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Message or design on slips of paper that are gummed or otherwise treated to adhere to a surface. Also included book owners' identification labels (ex libris); usually intended for attaching inside a book. Book plates may be attached or detached.

ITEM.name: poster
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Single or multi-sheet chiefly pictorial notice made for posting, usually in a public place, to attract attention to events, activities, causes, goods, or services. The purely decorative posters made since about 1960 are included.

ITEM.name: postcard
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Card with a graphic scene on one side, on which a message may be written or printed for mailing without an envelope

ITEM.name: greetings card
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Card sent or given on special occasions; usually bearing messages of good will.

ITEM.name: chart
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: An opaque sheet that exhibits information in a graphic or tabular form, e.g. a wall chart.

ITEM.name: playing cards
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Cards made in sets of a designated number of cards and marked for use in playing one or more games or telling fortunes; marks may follow a standard suit and rank system or may be special designs.

ITEM.name: flash card
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: A card or other opaque material printed with words, numerals, or pictures and designed for rapid display. Activity cards are included here.

ITEM.name: ephemera
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Transient everyday items, usually printed and on paper, that are manufactured for a specific limited use, then often thrown away. Also included everyday items that are meant to be saved, at least for a while.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: THREE-DIMENSIONAL ARTEFACTS AND REALIA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to three-dimensional artefacts and realia as defined by ISBD(NBM) for library and museum-based cataloguing.

SUBFIELD.name: Coded Data for Three-Dimensional Artefacts and Realia
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data entered in $a is identified by character position within the subfield. The subfield is currently always nine characters in length. Conventionally the character positions are numbered 0-8. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Specific Material Designation
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code is used to record the specific material designation that describes the special class of material (usually the class of physical object) to which the item belongs. The following codes are used:

PSUBFIELD.name: Material
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code is used to specify the type of material the three-dimensional artefact or realia is made of. There are three two-character positions for type of material codes and they should be entered from left to right, any unused positions being filled with blanks. The following codes are used:

PSUBFIELD.name: Colour 2
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code is used to specify the colour of the three-dimensional artefact and realia. The following codes are used:

ITEM.name: one-colour, monochrome
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is executed in one colour (monochrome).

ITEM.name: black-and-white
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is executed in black and white.

ITEM.name: multicoloured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is executed in more than one colour.

ITEM.name: hand coloured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is hand coloured.

ITEM.name: mixed
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The work or collection is a combination of one-colour, black-and-white, coloured, hand-coloured, and/or other images.

ITEM.name: not applicable
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The characteristic is not appropriate to the type of material being presented.

ITEM.name: other
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The item is other than specified above.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS - GENERAL
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains fixed-length coded data generally applicable to cartographic material.

MANDATORY-CONDITION.NOTES: This field is mandatory for cartographic materials

SUBFIELD.name: Cartographic Material Coded Data (General
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: All data is entered in subfield $a and identified by character position within the subfield. Conventionally the character positions are numbered from 0 to 12. All character positions defined must appear in the subfield. Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Colour indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the use of colour on the item.

PSUBFIELD.name: Index indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether the item carries an index or name list.

ITEM.name: index or name list on cartographic item itself
index or name list accompanying cartographic item in booklet, pamphlet, unattached cover, etc.
index or name list present but location not specified

PSUBFIELD.name: Narrative text indicator
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates whether the item has text.

ITEM.name: text accompanying cartographic item in booklet, pamphlet, unattached cover, etc.

PSUBFIELD.name: Relief codes
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Alphabetic character codes indicate the types of relief. The list is intended to encode only the most commonly found types of relief representation. Up to four codes can be used (left justified); unused positions contain blanks, when no relief code is applied, the four character positions contain blanks. The types are recorded in the record in order of their importance to the material being described.

ITEM.name: other methods in colour (e.g. in the style of Imhof)
landforms (e.g. in the style of Lobeck, Raisz, Fenneman)

PSUBFIELD.name: Map projection
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code indicates the type of projection if the projection is on the item.

ITEM.name: azimuthal, specific type unknown of the World

PSUBFIELD.name: Prime meridian
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code indicates the prime meridian of the item when it is mentioned or is easily determined. Up to two prime meridians can be specified (left justified); unused positions contain blanks.

RELATED.name: CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS-GEODETIC,GRID AND VERTICAL MEASUREMENT
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field describes other physical attributes.

RELATED.name: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS : MATHEMATICAL DATA
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Contains statements of projection in the form required by ISBD(CM).

RELATED.name: PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field also contains data about an item's colour.

EXAMPLES.EX: 120 ##$abyaa###bdaa## A coloured map has text on it but no index. The projection is Mercator's, relief is shown by contours and the prime meridian is Greenwich.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS: PHYSICAL ATTRIBUTES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains coded data relating to the physical attributes of cartographic materials.

SUBFIELD.name: Cartographic Material Coded Data: Physical attributes (General). Not repeatable.

PSUBFIELD.name: Physical dimension
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the physical dimensions of the item.

PSUBFIELD.name: Primary cartographic image
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: One-character codes indicate the techniques used for the creation of the primary cartographic image. Up to two techniques can be recorded (left justified); unused positions contain blanks. Printed line map is coded: a# Photomap enhanced with line map features is coded: ba MSS satellite remote sensing image is coded: e# Radar remote sensing image is coded: d#

ITEM.name: manually and plotted
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. maps produced by plotting instruments such as stereo plotters with or without computer assistance; maps drawn or painted by hand.

ITEM.name: photographically
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. cartographic items produced by conventional (visible spectrum) aerial photographic techniques such as aerial photography, photo maps, orthophotos.

ITEM.name: by computer
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: E.g. maps produced by a computer line printer.

ITEM.name: by active remote sensing techniques
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Excludes techniques covered by codes a, b, or c.

ITEM.name: by passive remote sensing techniques
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Excludes techniques covered by codes a, b, or c.

PSUBFIELD.name: Physical medium
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code indicates the physical medium of the cartographic item. The first character of the code indicates the general type of physical medium. The second character gives the specific type. This code is used to show that the cartographic item is made of the material indicated, e.g. when the cartographic item is a metal plate, a lithographic stone, a scribed plate on a plastic base, etc. Non-photographic medium:

ITEM.name: textile including manmade fibre textiles (e.g. silk, cloth, nylon)
magnetic storage medium - not computer compatible
transparent or opaque flexible base positive
transparent or opaque flexible base negative
transparent or opaque non-flexible base positive
transparent or opaque non-flexible base negative

PSUBFIELD.name: Creation technique
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the final step creation technique of the original cartographic item. Printed photomap enhanced with line map feature: b Photomap on photographic paper: c

ITEM.name: manuscript
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Hand drawn, including constructions of unique items such as stone carvings, models, etc.

ITEM.name: printing
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Offset, engraving, wood block print, lithographed, stamped, Braille, relief, etc.

ITEM.name: photocopying
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: All macroform hard copy produced directly on opaque material by radiant energy through contact or projection.

ITEM.name: microphotography
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: All microform copy on transparent material produced either by filming or by computer output.

ITEM.name: the cartographic item is not a final product but is on a preproduction medium as specified in character positions 3-4, Physical medium

PSUBFIELD.name: Form of reproduction
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the form of reproduction of the item.

ITEM.name: transfer line print (e.g., Xerox, blueprints, ozalid)

PSUBFIELD.name: Geodetic adjustment
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the geodetic adjustment of the item. Further details are given in field 131.

PSUBFIELD.name: Physical form of publication
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the physical form of publication of the item.

ITEM.name: as a separate supplement to a journal, monograph, etc.
bound into a journal, monograph, etc.

SUBFIELD.name: Aerial Photography and Remote Sensing Coded Data: Physical Attributes.
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Not repeatable

PSUBFIELD.name: Altitude of sensor
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the altitude of the sensor's platform for cartographic items.

PSUBFIELD.name: Attitude of sensor
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the attitude of the sensed image resulting from the angle of the sensor when recording the image for cartographic items.

PSUBFIELD.name: Spectral bands
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two numeric characters indicate the number of spectral bands involved. The number is right justified, unused positions contain zeros. Applicable only to remote sensing.01 to 99 = number of bands xx = not applicable

PSUBFIELD.name: Quality of image
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A one-character code indicates the quality of the image.

PSUBFIELD.name: Cloud cover
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A numeric character indicates the cloud cover in eighths

PSUBFIELD.name: Mean value of ground resolution
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A two-character code indicates the mean value of the ground resolution. Character position 6 carries either the numeric mean value for the resolution or an indication that it is less than 1 centimetre or greater than 9 kilometres. Character position 7 carries a code for the metric unit used. Applicable only to remote sensing.

PSUBFIELD.name: Metric unit codes
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Examples: Mean ground resolution of 5 centimetres: 5c Mean ground resolution of 80 metres: 8d Mean ground resolution of 10 kilometres: +k Not remote sensing: xx

RELATED.name: CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS - GENERAL
CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS - GEODETIC, GRID AND VERTICAL MEASUREMENT
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: These fields are used to code other attributes of cartographic materials.

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: TIME PERIOD OF ITEM CONTENT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains a formatted indication of the period covered by the item.

SUBFIELD.name: Time period, 9999 B.C. to present (EX 2,3). Repeatable (EX 1)
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Subfield $a consists of a minimum of 5 characters and a maximum of 11. The components are: $a/0 Era identifier $a/1-4 Year. If one optional code is used, all the earlier optional codes must be used.

PSUBFIELD.name: Era identifier
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: One alphabetic character (Mandatory):

ITEM.name: date falls before the year 1 in the Gregorian calendar, i.e. B.C.
date falls after the year 1 in the Gregorian calendar, i.e. A.D.

PSUBFIELD.name: Year
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Four numeric characters, right justified; unused positions contain zeros. Mandatory.

PSUBFIELD.name: Month
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two numeric characters, right justified; unused positions contain zeros. Optional.

PSUBFIELD.name: Day
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two numeric characters, right justified; unused positions contain zeros. Optional.

PSUBFIELD.name: Time
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Two numeric characters, right justified; unused positions contain zeros. Based on a 24 hour clock, local time, rounded to the nearest whole hour. Optional.

RELATED.name: GENERAL PROCESSING DATA
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: Date of publication (character positions 8-16) This field is used as well as or instead of field 122 where the date of issue is the same as the time period of item content.

RELATED.name: TIME PERIOD CODE
RELATED.DESCRIPTION: This field contains the Time Period Code, indicating only the decades covered by the item. It may be used as well as or instead of field 122.

EXAMPLES.EX: 122 2#$ad1971$ad1979 122 0#$ad1986 Codes for a map surveyed between 1971 and 1979 and then revised to add 1986 information.
122 0#$ad16051105 The code for Guy Fawkes' Gunpowder Plot, 5 November 1605
122 0#$ad1976080214 The situation date (2 August 1976, 14:08 hours) of a remote sensing image

FIELD.name: CODED DATA FIELD: CARTOGRAPHIC MATERIALS - SCALE AND CO-ORDINATES
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field contains the scale and co-ordinate data as entered in field 206 but in coded form.

MANDATORY-CONDITION.NOTES: This field is mandatory and repeatable when the document contains material with different scales e geographic coordenates.

SUBFIELD.name: Type of Scale (Mandatory)
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Not repeatable. A one-character code indicating the type of scale with the following values:

ITEM.name: other type of scale (e.g., time scale, quantitative statistical scale)

SUBFIELD.name: Constant Ratio Linear Horizontal Scale
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The horizontal scale in the form of the denominator of a representative fraction. Used for planetary as well as terrestrial cartographic items. Repeatable.

SUBFIELD.name: Constant Ratio Linear Vertical Scale
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical scale in the form of the denominator of a representative fraction. Used for planetary as well as terrestrial items. Repeatable.

SUBFIELD.name: Co-ordinates - Westernmost Longitude
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for planetary or terrestrial items. Each subfield is fixed at 8 characters and is not repeatable. Each contains the following data

PSUBFIELD.name: Hemisphere
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hemisphere: one-character code:

PSUBFIELD.name: Degree
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Degree: 3 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Co-ordinates - Easternmost Longitude
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for planetary or terrestrial items. Each subfield is fixed at 8 characters and is not repeatable. Each contains the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hemisphere
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hemisphere: one-character code:

PSUBFIELD.name: Degree
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Degree: 3 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Co-ordinates - Northernmost Latitude
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for planetary or terrestrial items. Each subfield is fixed at 8 characters and is not repeatable. Each contains the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hemisphere
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hemisphere: one-character code:

PSUBFIELD.name: Degree
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Degree: 3 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Co-ordinates - Southernmost Latitude
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for planetary or terrestrial items. Each subfield is fixed at 8 characters and is not repeatable. Each contains the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hemisphere
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hemisphere: one-character code:

PSUBFIELD.name: Degree
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Degree: 3 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Angular Scale
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: The angular scale of celestial maps in the form of a 4 character number right justified and filled with zeros, giving the scale in terms of millimetres to a degree. Repeatable.

SUBFIELD.name: Declination - Northern Limit
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for celestial cartographic items. Subfields are not repeatable. Subfields $i and $j are each 8 characters long and contain the same components as subfields $f and $g (see above) except that character position 0 contains a plus sign (for the northern celestial hemisphere) or a minus sign (for the southern celestial hemisphere). Subfields $k and $m are each 6 characters long and contain the following data

PSUBFIELD.name: Hour
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hour: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Declination - Southern Limit
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for celestial cartographic items. Subfields are not repeatable. Subfields $i and $j are each 8 characters long and contain the same components as subfields $f and $g (see above) except that character position 0 contains a plus sign (for the northern celestial hemisphere) or a minus sign (for the southern celestial hemisphere). Subfields $k and $m are each 6 characters long and contain the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hour
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hour: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Right ascension - Eastern Limits
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for celestial cartographic items. Subfields are not repeatable. Subfields $i and $j are each 8 characters long and contain the same components as subfields $f and $g (see above) except that character position 0 contains a plus sign (for the northern celestial hemisphere) or a minus sign (for the southern celestial hemisphere). Subfields $k and $m are each 6 characters long and contain the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hour
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hour: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Right ascension - Western Limits
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Co-ordinates for celestial cartographic items. Subfields are not repeatable. Subfields $i and $j are each 8 characters long and contain the same components as subfields $f and $g (see above) except that character position 0 contains a plus sign (for the northern celestial hemisphere) or a minus sign (for the southern celestial hemisphere). Subfields $k and $m are each 6 characters long and contain the following data:

PSUBFIELD.name: Hour
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Hour: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Minute
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Minute: 2 numeric characters, right justified, filled with zeros

PSUBFIELD.name: Second
PSUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: Second: 2 numeric characters right justified, filled with zeros

SUBFIELD.name: Equinox
SUBFIELD.DESCRIPTION: n Equinox The equinox for celestial cartographic items with the year entered according to the Gregorian calendar as a four character date right justified with zeros. Not repeatable.

SUBFIELD.name: Epoch
